Do you have the drive to get things done especially under time pressure? Are you keen to learn?
If so, we’d love to hear from you.  

This is a busy and varied role within a small boutique management consultancy where you will be providing effective and efficient administrative support to achieve agreed client objectives and the smooth day-to-day running of the business. 

The role requires energy, initiative, and the ability to work on multiple projects at once. We would like to recruit someone enthusiastic, keen to learn, and able to plan, prioritise and deliver to tight timescales.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

The survey portal MOBROG.COM is looking for participants from UK, who are interested in completing online surveys. For each completed survey you can be awarded with between 0,50£ and 3,00£. The participation in, and the registration for, the surveys is of course for free and non-binding. Create the future with us and get paid for your opinion.

What we offer

  • Gain money with interesting surveys
  • Duration and payment of the survey is always known in advance
  • Paying out from 5£ via PayPal (no transaction costs!)
  • Privacy is 100% granted
  • Participation in market research and science
  • Flexible Working hours & working place
  • Top reviews at Trust Pilot (9.0 out of 10 with >4000 reviews)

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • No work experience requried
  • Honest participation in the surveys to the best of the knowledge and belief
  • Enthusiasm to be part of online surveys
  • Must be from United Kingdom
  • No schooling required

Apply

MOBROG is an offer run by the market research company SPLENDID RESEARCH GmbH located in Germany. We carry out online surveys worldwide via the internet and our mobile app. 
Our survey portals are implemented in a global network, so we are able to perform broad surveys at a high quality level. 
Participants of our surveys receive a compensation for their time, which they can receive via Paypal. 
In order to maintain a permanent high quality, we acknowledge the international codex for Market and Social Research of the ICC/ESOMAR and our services conform with the guidelines of MRS, CASRO, MRA & ARF for international market research.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Generally, each survey will pay a different reward, depending on how niche or long the survey is. You will be rewarded for every survey you complete with earnings.

After completing your free registration on our website, members will have access to our shopping portal full of a variety of shopping merchants.

What we offer

  • Earn cash for surveys, offers and more
  • Receive cash to your paypal account
  • Take part in surveys and get rewards for your opinion

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • You live in the UK
  • Work experience not needed

Apply

Are you the perfect candidate? Click the button 'apply now'!

What are you going to do

What we offer

text:
What are you going to do

Whether you’re looking for babysitter or nanny jobs the tasks involved typically vary according to the children’s age and the working hours. Make sure you discuss these issues in advance with any potential employer.

Tasks may include:

  • Afternoon childcare after preschool or school
  • Playtime with the kids, including trips and events
  • Meal preparation
  • Feeding and changing diapers
  • Homework help
  • Bedtime
  • Overnight care

What we offer

  • Flexible working hours
  • Working in a family environment
  • Different and varied activities

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • Enjoy working with children
  • Experience in childcare is an advantage

By registering on Care.com you create you a personal profile where you can add your photos, experience, availability and qualification. Then browse local opportunities, contact potential employers and apply for jobs online.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

We are looking for tech tutors to work in London and other locations (Chester, Maidenhead, Milton Keynes, Northwood, Oxford, Reading, Richmond and Tonbridge).

If you are proactive, responsible and committed we would love to hear from you. Your job will be to provide every child you teach with the experience of a lifetime, whilst delivering outstanding tech skills and cutting edge knowledge.

Leadership and management skills are also a positive, but what we like most of all is lots of energy, stamina, flexibility and a good sense of humour.

What we offer

  • Competitive pay
  • Subsidised accommodation
  • Selected tutors receive full paediatric first aid training
  • Full technical training on courses you will be required to teach
  • Teacher training including how to work with children with educational requirements
  • An unforgetable experience!

What we ask:

  • You should be registered as a university student
  • No experience needed
  • Demonstrate a good understanding of programming
  • Passion for technology
  • Able to think fast and act quickly
  • Work under pressure but still provide children with an experience of a lifetime
  • Liaise well on all levels
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Presentable and punctual at all times
  • Leadership and Management Skills
  • Energy, stamina, flexibility and a good sense of humour

Please note - the final application closing date for this position is the 5th July, however applications will be considered on a rolling basis.

For more information:

https://funtechsummercamps.com/jobs

Apply

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Make extra income by taking surveys, watching videos or simply searching the web at Swagbucks. Be part of a community of 15+ million members who have already earned over £84 million.

Swagbucks is the globally renowned rewards program that puts cash back in your wallet. Get cash or free gift cards for the everyday things you are already doing online like shopping, searching, and watching videos plus get paid to give your opinions to top brands. They want to hear what you have to say.

Most Swagbucks members are active from home, during work breaks or in their commutes so Swagbucks is as fun and rewarding for you as can be.

Swagbucks members accrue points (called SB) which are then redeemed for cash from Paypal or gift vouchers from Amazon, Marks & Spencer, Argos and other top brands!

There are multiple ways to earn daily from your computer or mobile phone. Here are some you can perform to start earning straightaway:

  • Get paid to take surveys
  • Watch videos and play games
  • Find great discount codes, latest deals and get cash back by shopping at your favourite brands
  • Search the web. Use the Swagbucks search engine just like you would use Google

What we offer

  • Flexible hours
  • Fun, easy way to make money
  • Great pay & reward programme

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • Previous work experience is not required
  • Access to computer or mobile phone

Apply

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

We would like to challenge you and become a part of our team! Are you ready to really exceed expectations? Develop your own talents and inspire others in becoming the best they can? Than we are looking for you!

We are looking for the right young professionals who want to start working in hospitality. Become a part of a new branch in the UK, which prides themselves in guaranteeing success on the work-floor and haves lots of FUN during and after work!

After work, share a drink with your friends and colleagues is something which we consider to be 100% MEP and we look forward to welcoming you to our community! We focus highly in creating added value through trainings, workshops, masterclasses in order for you to improve your career possibilities! In addition, we have an abundance of career possibilities in other European cities as well!

What we offer

  • Absolute flexibility
  • Varied, exciting events throughout the year
  • Excellent salary with ability to grow and increase wages
  • Working within a young, dynamic team and becoming a member of our great international community!
  • Become a part of our MEP Academy and have the ability to follow an abundance of fun and exciting trainings & workshops

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • You to always exceed expectations
  • Previous work experience within hospitality is a plus
  • Willingness to work at least 4x a month
  • Fun to work with and team player
  • Native / impeccable knowledge of English language
  • Join us for FUN activities after work!
  • You have to be 18 and over
  • Prior experience in hospitality would be great!

Apply

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Upcoming Events: All Points East, The Ends, Parklife, Download, Isle of Wight Festival, BST,
TRNSMT, Bluedot, Latitude, MADE Festival, Wilderness, Reading & Leeds, SW4, Elrow, among
many others!

  • We staff weekend festivals, day festivals, hospitality events, market research roles, sports stadiums
    and more.
  • Roles available: Bar Staff, Managers, Supervisors, Bar Backs, Cocktail Bartenders, Wait Staff,
    Hosts, Wristbanding and Event Crew & Market Research Assistants.

What we offer

  • For many festivals and events we provide complimentary staff transport to and from major cities.
  • At a camping event we provide two meals a day, this is usually a packed lunch and hot meal voucher.
  • Flexible work- choose shifts and events that suit you.
  • Work with your friends.
  • Pay rate is always Minimum Wage or above. Pay rate and required hours will vary dependent on event and role you are working.
  • Have the best summer ever!

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • Outgoing, positive personality.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Well presented.
  • Work well under pressure and as part of a team.
  • Reliable and Trustworthy.
  • Previous experience is not essential; your personal qualities and a 'can do' attitude is what counts! Training is provided on site and online through our HAP Academy.

Applicants must, be 18 years of age or over (due to licencing laws) and be a UK/EU resident or a non-resident with a valid UK work permit.

Apply

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

STRAMMER is an international leading player in Talent Acquisition (Middle & Top Management), Talent Management and Outplacement across the Life Sciences industry (Pharmaceutical , Biotechnology, Medical Device). In 2016, STRAMMER created the Full Talent Solution®, the first talent strategy offering dedicated to Life Sciences, to support organisations with a diverse offering, in order to impact their business by strengthening and optimising their business’s human capital.

This unique and exciting internship is an opportunity: as an active member of our intern’s community, you will partner with our business leaders across Europe on Senior Management recruitments (VPs, General Managers, Leaders and high calibre scientists), improve and develop your ability to find and approach the best talents in the Life Sciences industries.

What are you going to do

Are you an undergraduate searching for an internship? This experience is designed to give you the skills you need to succeed in e-commerce. The training you receive will start with an introduction to the technical and soft skills you will need to make an impact, and will continue as you work on live projects, learning first hand how we deliver for our customers. Your responsibilities will be to:

  • Ensure fresh, new and relevant content is added across all our UK brands
  • Create written and visual content
  • Produce marketing material- posters, leaflets, and newsletters
  • Get involved with our social media platforms
  • Plan and organise relevant marketing campaigns
  • Promote new features and engage with existing customers
  • Gain exposure to our email marketing activities
  • Become an expert in Google Analytics and Google Adwords
  • Keep up to date with the companies SEO activities

What we offer

  • UK office is only a short walk away from East Croydon station, which has excellent train links to Central London, allowing access to the city in just 25 minutes.
  • Facilities boast a modern work environment and play area. Whether you are into gaming, pool, table tennis, football or simply socialising, we would love for you to come and join our very unique atmosphere.
  • We encourage team collaboration and provide excellent meeting facilities, with the latest technology and practices. We believe that if you create work environments that allow people to feel inspired, it will attract better people and bring success.

The Company

Established a little over twelve years ago, we have organically grown from a start up to a multinational company, with offices in 3 continents and covering 13 markets, globally. We have done this by creating world-class e-commerce brands and achieving year on year growth. Based in East Croydon, we are part of a group that has great financial stability and we are continuing our year on year growth plan.

Who We Want

  • We want original, collaborative and passionate people who are open to new ideas, eager to learn, with a love of solving problems.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Holiday work in France perfect for students over the holidays, I have this advertisement in the "Jobs" section as you do get paid well, but people do this for the experience. I am a semi-retired Businessman, never married so no kids to share my holiday trips with, so for the past 20 years I have been employing young people anyone not too happy in their present job that are keen to try something new.

This is a fantastic opportunity for students, gap year, graduate still looking for that "proper job", students studying a foreign language, or young people with an interest in travel. This trip can also suit someone in employment that has some holiday entitlement to use up - I can do trips in 2 weeks, basically I can go several times a year between April and October, whenever I have a suitable companion. My hobbies and Business are inseparable: Building work, cars, boats and I work with a range of tradespeople in Nottingham. I have two French houses and boats in Brittany and St Tropez. I am best known as designer and manufacturer of sports cars (Google "Spartan Cars")and I have 3 of my own as well as Porsche and Jaguar, France trips usually use big Nissan Patrol and a trailer loaded with building materials for the two house renovation projects plus mechanics tools as I cannot resist disappearing in the engine room on my boat (Google Trader 47). Luckily you have your own en suite cabin "Boat is gorgeous" said Lizzie who did two trips.

The role includes shopping, cleaning, cooking and general maintenance duties. You will have free time to spend at the beach or around town. Travel is paid in full to include travel car journey down to France, in farmhouse, B and B's Flying home is an option on the arranged availability/date. On the journey down we stay at my two house renovation projects and we will do some work there with general duties, before heading off to one of the boats.

The Journeys end is near St Tropez where I rent a mobile home (Google "Parc St James" and/or "Direct Holiday Homes 5144B" to see actual one we rented last year). If your application is successful, we will arrange for you to speak to someone who knows me as a reference or someone that has been on the trip previously. Lauren, Lizzie, Claire all did the trip twice, Joanne and Jenny both came again (unpaid) as guests.

The next stage is to have a conversation, after this we arrange to meet in person with you. You may work for a few days in one of my Nottingham businesses to see if you get on with me and my family before going on the trip. I never hire anyone I have not met, and you would be most unwise to work abroad without meeting the employer. Interviews at my nephews business, Photo Nottingham which is a 15 minute walk from bus/tram stations, just a short walk from Victoria shopping centre underground car park.

Anyone living within 50 miles is free to attend an interview by appointment which can be evenings or a Saturday/Sunday, but if you are more than that distance you must phone for a good chat to assure that you are a top candidate.

The ideal candidate: physically fit, not necessarily a sports star but if I say "Run back I left my camera in that Café" I mean run.

Above average education, doesn't matter what subjects, and family background in business or the professions so that you have seen people climb life's ladder (even if you have slithered down a rung or two) and thus you intend to do the same.

We never go on this trip until you have completed a day or two working for me and have met several family members. We also never go until you have had a good chat with someone who has previously done the trip.

What we offer

  • Free time
  • Agreed pay amount
  • Buisness experience
  • All expenses paid

What we ask:

  • At least finished high school
  • Good talker
  • Good listener
  • Reliable
  • Handy
  • Fun

If you would like any more information a full document will be sent to you upon application, once you have decided if the trip will be right for you we candiscuss an ideal time for an interview.

Apply

If your are interested in joing me on this once in a lifetime opportunity there is no harm in applying. If you would like to know more just ring me on 07976 756402 and I will asnwer any questions.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

We're very excited to be launching The Perspectives Programme, a 9 month internship placement for people at the start of their career in the health world. We're looking for two interns to join our team.

The programme is designed to discover new and creative ways to tackle how to promote unheard voices in the context of health and care.

Although we are big fans of a cup of tea at Kaleidoscope, we don't want interns who are glorified tea makers (although in fairness, cups of tea are probably a key part of all of our roles).

This internship is about making a real difference, so alongside supporting client delivery, interns will be supported to design and lead on their own project to improve the way unheard voices are heard in healthcare.

The programme is open to all applicants, no matter their background or experience provided they have a passion for improving health and care, and a plan for promoting unheard voices and celebrating diversity.

For the first round of recruitment we just want to know about a project that candidates think we should invest in.  We want you to reflect on your experience or that of family or friends, and pitch us a project (which will take approx 1 day per week over 9 months to deliver) that promotes a way in which health and healthcare can hear from unheard voices. We've done lots of different and wonderful stuff so anything is possible (well, almost!) as long as it addresses the way unheard voices are heard in health care.

For the duration of the internship we will support you to spend approximately 20% of your time (1 day a week over a 9 month period) developing and delivering a project to promote unheard voices in healthcare. What this project will look like is up to you - telling the stories of a marginalised group, a project to hear lived experiences in policymaking, or something completely different!

But (and this is important) as well as offering you a chance to design and deliver your own programme we will also give you real experience of consultancy and the health and policy sector.  From the outset we will expect you to work as part of Kaleidoscope supporting client delivery and leading pieces of your own work - all done with the overt aim of building your skills and confidence in the workplace.

We do "traditional consultancy" through advising health and care organisations on their strategy, we support networks and partnerships, we design and facilitate a whole host of face-to-face and digital events and we work with clients across the public, private and voluntary sectors. But we also like to play with ideas that help our mission, even if it costs us money to do it.  We're going to keep thinking up new ideas and seeing which work wonderfully, which flop fantastically, and which should never be touched by anyone, ever again.

We're proud of what we're doing at Kaleidoscope, and we want to share this with as many people as possible. Diversity of thought and experience is incredibly important and if we want to continue to grow as an organisation that produces fresh and creative ideas, we need to support a variety of voices and perspectives to be a part of Kaleidoscope.

We are not able to sponsor any visas at this point, so all applicants must be eligible to work in the UK and over 18 years of age.

What we offer

  • Real work experience as part of a programme team delivering client contracts
  • 9 month placement paid at London Living Wage
  • Opportunity to deliver your own project from design to implementation
  • Flexible working with options to work from home/remote work
  • Exposure to a diverse range of events in health, social care & policy
  • A mentor
  • Optional short placements
  • Visits within our network of organisations and partners
  • Free lunches every day
  • Table tennis matches on the office balcony

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required but candidates must be literate, numerate and comfortable using a computer to produce documents
  • We don’t want this to be an internship advertised for ‘early career starters’ where you also need a Masters degree, 3 years of work experience and a knighthood to apply. Because to be honest, in most cases it’s probably not necessary.
  • Committed to diversity. Able to draw on personal lived experience to promote diversity in health and/or at Kaleidoscope
  • A passion for improving health and care, who wants to promote unheard voices and celebrate diversity
  • A keen interest in the health and care world. No formal expertise required - just lots of enthusiasm and interest in our work
  • Organisational brilliance. From experience of running projects to organising a huge birthday bash for your Mum's fiftieth; we're looking for someone who can juggle a lot while having an eye for detail.
  • A flexible and proactive attitude. Thumb twiddlers need not apply. And while office yoga is not (yet) mandatory, you will have to be happy taking responsibility for a range of different tasks with an ability to adapt quickly.
  • Tech savvy. You don't need to be a complete IT whizz, but a bit of tech skill combined with creativity won't go amiss.
  • Resilience. Kaleidoscope is no fairy-tale; and as a start-up without a genie propping us up with stacks of gold, we've no right to exist. Tolerance of ambiguity is key here.
  • A bucket load of charm. You know how to talk to all-sorts, and like doing so too. You'll also understand what it takes to work well in a team (please note, we accept gifts of biscuits all days of the week but prefer cake on Fridays).

Application Process

Round one: Project Pitch (closing date: 9am Monday 24th June 2019)

As part of the Perspectives Programme we will support you to spend a day a week of your 9 month placement to develop and deliver a project which will improve how unheard voices are heard more clearly in the context of healthcare.

Reflecting on your experience or that of your family or friends, pitch us a project (which will take approx 1 day per week over 9 months to deliver) which promotes a way in which health and health care can hear from unheard voices.

We will assess your project proposal using 3 criteria;

  • Rationale for idea/imagination shown in the idea itself
  • Project approach (how you would do it)
  • Outcomes/creating change (what would change as a result?)

Please outline your proposal, of no more than 2 A4 pages and submit it as the "Motivation Letter" on your application. Only include your initials and mobile number as identifiers on the proposal (put these on both pages).

Have questions? Have a look at our website here or email us (with "Intern Application" as the subject) if you have specific queries we can help with.

Thank you! We hope to hear from you.

Apply

Are you the perfect candidate? Click the button 'apply now' and we'll contact you as soon as possible!

text:
What are you going to do

As Facilities & Culture Intern at Fnatic, you'll be the friendly face to greet visitors to our amazing HQ in Shoreditch and a key support across our People & Culture function. Our office is a creative, buzzy place; and we need someone with the same level of energy to make it an even better place for our guests and staff alike.

You'll support the overall management of the office and other London facilities as well as own important administrative tasks, working closely with People & Culture colleagues to support our goal of making Fnatic a recognised employer of choice in London. You'll also help share how great our office is with the world, gathering content to paint the picture of life at Fnatic externally. The perfect candidate is someone with incredible attention to detail, from being across all of our supply levels, to noticing browning of office plants and chairs out of place in meeting rooms, and typos in documents.

This is a great opportunity to grow and make your mark in an industry getting more massive by the day, esports!

Your mission is to:

  • Manage Fnatic's front of house/reception, creating a memorable first impression for all visitors of Fnatic and our culture
  • Own the booking calendars for meeting rooms, streaming studio and other owned spaces, as well as ensuring they are always functional and ready for use

  • Ensure we offer a great candidate experience when prospective employees come for interview, and support talent acquisition administration
  • Conduct research as required for new suppliers, initiatives and events

What we offer

  • Regular lunch clubs and other social activities

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

1 Introducing Innovation Gateway

The Innovation Gateway partnership enables partners to transform the performance of their buildings, through sharing experience and by sourcing the most exciting innovations in energy, waste, water, productivity, wellbeing and more. Clients include world-leading organisations like Tesco, Heathrow, Kingfisher plc, RBS, Nottingham City Council and Greene King.

We believe that we are onto something really exciting and we are looking for like-minded people to join us on our journey to making sustainable business happen. Innovation Gateway's DNA is a set of values and behaviours that unites our team.

  • Collaboration – Working with our colleagues and clients to make sure our sum is greater than our parts. Collaboration is a way of doing business, a way of unlocking value and a mind-set.
  • Passionate – What we're doing isn't easy. We passionately believe it's the right thing to do which is why we are so determined, focused and proud to do the work we do.
  • Trusted and trusting – Everything we do relies on building trusting relationships. We strive to provide a safe, non-competitive environment where our clients and innovators can collaborate. Our role is to earn this trust.
  • Making it happen – We have a can-do attitude and like getting things done. How else are we going to make sustainable business happen?

You'll work with amazing people. You will be part of an ambitious team, and work with colleagues who are motivated by a belief that the work they do positively contributes to the world we live in.

You'll make a difference. You will be able to see how the work you do is valuable to our Partners. We encourage new ideas and will give you the chance to run with them whenever they make sense.

We value your personal growth. You will have a chance to develop your skills and learn new things from day one.

2 Position overview

The Innovation Gateway has an exciting opportunity for an experienced graduate to join the Innovation Sourcing team. You will seek to understand the building performance challenges of our Partners and source innovative solutions.

Primarily supporting our delivery team, this role will allow you to build on existing scientific and technical knowledge, to hone your skills and be part of facilitating conversations and connections at the forefront of innovation.

You will be working in an interesting field and will be able to see the personal contribution that you make to the clients we work with.

Location: Oxford, UK

Salary: £27,500 pa. (based on experience)

Term: Full-time

3 Specific responsibilities

  • Support the Innovation Manager in all innovation sourcing activities including:
    • Acquiring a thorough understanding of the challenges our clients face, researching industry baselines, and identifying solutions to these challenges.
    • Participating in phone calls with Partners, innovators and industry experts, build relationships and be able to confidently discuss a wide range of subject areas.
    • Creating and compiling documentation relevant to the process, such as research briefs that clearly summarise the scope of an opportunity.
    • Supporting the team in hosting events, including our twice-yearly Pitch Day.
  • Create technical reports based on innovations that have been successfully piloted by our Partners.
  • Manage the upload, maintenance and quality of data in our innovation database.
  • Generate preparation materials for new client onboarding meetings and compile materials for follow up.
  • Attend conferences and events to constantly broaden your network, industry knowledge and identify innovation opportunities.

4 About you

Required

  • You have a scientific or engineering degree, or at least 5 years' experience in building services/performance.
  • You understand technology and are interested in how it can solve problems.
  • You're enthusiastic about helping clients to have more sustainable buildings and reduce their environmental impact.
  • You are a team player, who loves learning about a wide range of subject areas.
  • You embrace change and can work on projects autonomously and with minimal supervision.
  • You like multitasking, and are good at prioritising your workload whilst maintaining quality.
  • You have strong verbal and written skills, with excellent attention to detail.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working
  • Working from home

What we ask:

  • At least finished university degree
  • You have a scientific or engineering degree, or at least 5 years' experience in building services/performance.
  • You are interested in technology.
  • You’re enthusiastic about helping clients to have more sustainable buildings and reduce their environmental impact.
  • You embrace change and can work on projects autonomously and with minimal supervision.
  • You have strong verbal and written skills, with excellent attention to detail.

What are you going to do

Why urbanest? Easy.

We are a growing organisation with employees from all over the world. We embrace diversity, talent and ideas to improve and advance ourselves. At urbanest, we share success as a company. Help us be successful and we will help you achieve your goals. We aim to make urbanest a great place to work - and a great place to live.

Who are we?

We pride ourselves on delivering the highest quality accommodation and sector-leading service to students and universities. Currently we have six properties within Zone 1: Hoxton, Tower Bridge, King's Cross, St Pancras, Westminster Bridge and Vauxhall. With exciting projects in the pipeline, urbanest is continuing to grow.

Working with us?

Urbanest is building a strong positive reputation with some of the most prestigious universities in London. The people who run this company, care. We are passionate about investing in our employees and put a focus on developing and nurturing talent. Whether you decide to join our Customer and Property Management team or Central Support Office - you know you will be joining a company who consistently deliver excellent results within an exciting, fast-paced industry.

We are looking for Weekend Customer Support Assistants to join us in London, working between various locations in Kings Cross, St Pancras, Hoxton, Tower Bridge, Westminster Bridge and our brand new property opening in 2018, Vauxhall!

This role is a part-time weekend position, working 2-3 shifts across Friday/Saturday and Sunday.

You will be responsible for delivering excellent service to our customers, ensuring they have the best possible experience whilst living with us. This role is varied, fast-paced and an exciting opportunity to join a market-leading organisation.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Providing 'Front of House' services at our properties, responding to any resident queries or issues, ensuring all matters are dealt with in a professional and timely manner
  • Ensuring a high standard of customer service is delivered to all customers of urbanest

  • Supporting with the on boarding of new team members, assisting with training needs
  • Having a strong understanding of the student accommodation market, including competitors
  • Having a strong understanding of our main stakeholders within London

From the start, we will offer you a competitive salary and benefits package, regularly benchmarking ourselves against competitors within the industry. For more information on the range of benefits urbanest offer - visit our careers page, by searching 'urbanest careers'.

At urbanest we are committed to promoting equality and diversity within our team and creating an environment in which all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Urbanest will not tolerate unlawful discrimination, harassment and bullying based upon the following protected characteristics; age, disability, gender-reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

Due to the demographic of our residents, successful applicants for this position will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Check.

text:
What are you going to do

1) Use recent experience as a student to understand the best way to sell high volumes of university specific academic year wall planners to new and returning students in September and October 2019 at (all or some of) Liverpool, Manchester, Leeds and Sheffield universities. (retail price of approx £5 means a low cost discretionary purchase for students during freshers week and the following few weeks).

(please note these wall planners are specific to the term dates / exam dates etc for each univeristy - they are not generic - all designs will be shared with interested candidates).

2) Sales strategy may include selling to retailers (eg convenience stores in student areas) and / or direct to students (eg: at freshers fairs etc).

3) Preferably use and recruit contacts from other universities to gain insight across the Liverpool / Manchester / Sheffield / Leeds universities grouping - subcontracting or hiring of contacts at the other universities is not a problem. The right candidate will hopefully be able to build a sales group across some or all of the 4 cities to implement the optimal sales strategy.

4) Advise on social media and other marketing channels that may assist to drive awareness and sales. Engage and manage social media platforms as required to achieve desired objectives.

What we offer

  • £8 basic wage per hour plus sales commission+
  • Flexible hours to be agreed on a daily or weekly basis+ Flexible work location+ Freedom of decision making+ Excellent Commission and earning potential for achievement of targets+
  • Empowerment to drive a commercial strategy+ Potential for permanent role if swuccessful+

What we ask:

  • At least finished university degree Recent grad (or just about to graduate) from one of major universities in Liverpool, Manchester, Leeds or Sheffield+ Preferably based in Wirral / Merseyside / Cheshire area+
  • Business minded entrepreneurial graduate a must+ Outgoing, extrovert personality+ Street smart+ Prepared to get out there and make things happen+ Looking for an opportunity to test your commercial savyy and prove your skills+
  • Some demonstrable history of student type jobs to demonstrate work ability+
  • Business related discipline preferably+

I'm a Manchester graduate myself but that was a long time ago. After over 25 years of working overseas in the Middle East and Asia I now have the money and the time to bring to life entrepreneurial ideas that I couldn't possibly afford when I was 21.

This particular business idea needs a fresh graduate to implement because it's a product for university students. If you have a sharp commercial mind and don't see your near term future involving a couple of years of photocopying and other menial tasks in a big company on a faceless business park somewhere in the South of England then this may be for you. In 3 months you may achieve something that you'd never get the chance to do in a big company.

One last point worth mentioning - if you think wall planners are a defunct concept because of smartphones then this opportunity is probably not for you - you need to believe in the concept of a low cost but high quality wallplanner as a useful piece of student kit.

Thanks a lot for taking a look. Hope to hear from you if you think you tick the boxes. If nothing else you'll spend a bit of the summer on an interesting commercial challenge. Best case is we get wildly successful and you get a full time commercial director role in a fledgling company – there are dozens of other wall planners that can be made, including about 150 more universities to choose from in the UK alone, promotional calendar year planners, sponsored planners - basically an almost limitless set of possibilities.

Planamax is a trading style of Malarex Limited, (company number 11493739). We are based on the Wirral.

Apply

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Are you looking for a temporary role across the summer period?

Our very well- known client, the York Designer Outlet on the outskirts of York, is currently recruiting Cleaners for their very busy location.

Opening hours are 9am – 9pm Monday to Friday and 9am – 6pm Saturday and Sunday.

Due to a large increase in business over the summer holiday period, our client is looking to recruit additional staff from W/C 22nd July – Early September.

Location

Our client is based in the Village of Fulford which is accessible by own transport and regular public transport from both Selby and York city centre.

With this in mind, applicants are encouraged to ensure they are able to get to the location of work prior to applying.

Duties

For the role of cleaner duties will include;

  • Keeping the food hall clean – clearing table and trays
  • Clean and disinfect surfaces and floors and paintwork in the designated areas
  • Mop general flooring throughout the site
  • Regular clearance of waste bins providing new lining sacks as required within the designated working areas
  • Remove and dispose of identified items as directed
  • Ensure the safe storage for all chemicals and cleaning consumables
  • Ensure that the facilities and services operate in compliance with Health and Safety legislation and procedures
  • General assisting of the public may be required

For this role full uniform will be provided as well as all cleaning equipment.

Experience

For the cleaning role applicants who wish to apply should have the following skills and experience;

  • Good customer care skills
  • Able to exercise initiative and prioritise duties accordingly
  • Able to work to a high standard against agreed timescales with limited supervision

Full training is provided therefore previous cleaning experience is not essential.

Hours & Pay Rates

Due to their opening hours applicants should be aware shifts will be allocated any day Monday – Sunday

Shifts can include: 10.00 – 18.00, 11.00 – 19.00 and 12.00 – 20.00

Both Full and Part time shifts can be made available

Pay rate – £8.21

To Apply

Should you wish to apply for the cleaner role please, without delay email your CV or should you wish to speak about the role in detail please call 01482 213570 and ask for Louise for more information.

We receive a high number of applications and as such if you have successfully progressed to the next stage of application one of our consultants will contact you directly. YSS are committed to implementing a policy of equal opportunities. Should you wish to receive a copy of this policy please contact us.

In the event that, you have not heard from us within 7 days you can be rest assured, even if you are not successful for the advertised vacancy we will keep your CV and details on file for 6 months and as soon as we have a vacancy that suits your skills we will be in touch. YSS care deeply about your privacy and are therefore committed to processing your personal information in accordance with GDPR. Our full privacy policy can be found here.

Yorkshire Staffing Services are acting as an employment business for temporary assignments and an employment agency for permanent placements.

What we offer

  • Full Training
  • Uniform
  • flexible hours

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • Customer Service
  • Able to exercise initiative and prioritise duties accordingly
  • Able to work to a high standard against agreed timescales with limited supervision

Apply

We offer online English tuition to Chinese students of all ages. At Labby we are looking for outgoing teachers with excellent English pronunciation from around the world. We are looking for experienced and qualified (TEFL, TESOL, CELTA) English teachers, or those willing to study for a TEFL certificate once they start work. Unqualified ESL teachers can gain a TEFL certificate from us at a reduced price while they are working.

At Labby we provide three different forms of online tuition: 1v1, 1vN (2-9 students), and Group classes (10+ students). This means that our teachers have the unique opportunity to gain experience in a variety of online teaching formats. Our teachers can also increase their earnings as they gain experience and their skills improve. We provide all the teaching materials, so our teachers can focus on working with their students.

text:
What are you going to do

StudentJob International is a part of YoungCapital Group and active in The Netherlands, Germany, Belgium, France, Spain, UK., Sweden, Austria, Ireland and Switzerland as an online job board for students and graduates. In the past few years, we have been growing extensively and established client-relations with many international companies. Therefore we are looking for a sales representative for the UK market in our international team in Hoofddorp (a city nearby Amsterdam). In short: a great commercial challenge in an international environment! You will be mainly working on our job board Studentjob.co.uk 

Your most important tasks and responsibilities:

  • Sales and new business: Proactively generate new business with corporates/high volume companies or agencies through acquisition by telephone and the occasional face-to-face meetings.
  • Key account management: Develop an intensive relationship with your top 10 accounts, according to an account planning. This involves forecast, contact moments by phone and occasionally on location.
  • Manage relationships with all the existing clients.
  • Development and deployment of new products and services for your clients.
  • Build and manage a strong relationship with online marketing for operating the website.
  • Develop new products/services for your top clients, initiate pilots and tailor-made offerings.

What we offer

  • A strong foundation for your commercial career.
  • A substantive position in an international environment.
  • Good salary, reimbursement of travel expenses, a bonus and various incentive programs.
  • Education and training in our YoungCapital University.
  • A job where you work amongst fun colleagues in an international environment with the best atmosphere!
  • 25 holidays + additional 6,5 (ADV days)

What we ask:

  • At least finished university degree
  • You are a native English speaker
  • Experience in sales, HR, recruiting or online media is a huge plus
  • A born seller, entrepreneurial.
  • Excellent communicator, able to work independently
  • Ambitious, full of energy, eager to learn.

YoungCapital is the market leader for HR-solutions and young talent. Our services are focused on students, graduates, trainees, and young professionals. Internationally we have over 5 million active users in our network, this makes us the biggest network for online talent in Europe. Our clients are mostly large international companies and governments. Both in our job stores and headquarters, our people work with enthusiasm and passion for their jobs, which is to offer professional and flexible services to our clients! Are you curious as to what YoungCapital is more/all about? Go to our website www.youngcapital.nl

text:
What are you going to do

If you don't know by now, Zip World is North Wales'ultimate adventure destination. You can find yourself flying head-first over Penrhyn Quarry on the world's fastest zip line, hurtling through the Welsh woodland on the UK's first alpine coaster, or exploring an underground labyrinth at the UK's only subterranean net adventure. Zip World are committed to providing the most unique and thrilling adventures, from check-in to touch down. We started with a handful of employees in nothing more than a small cabin back in 2013 - fast forward nearly 6 years, and we're going from strength to strength, employing over 300 team members, operating at 3 stunning locations in NorthnWales.
As an instructor, your pivotal role will vary from day to day – you will be 'kitting-up' our customers, instructing, engaging, and generally preparing them for an experience of a lifetime. This can be a challenging role which often requires you to be operating in all weather conditions. We will provide you with full training, you just need to bring your enthusiasm, commitment and sense of adventure.

label: description
text:
What are you going to do

Why work for Scrumbles

Scrumbles is a fast-growing pet food start-up that is disrupting the market. We make natural, ethical cat and dog
food filling a gap in the market for a high quality, responsibly sourced pet food that's accessible. Despite an
increased understanding of animal nutrition, cats and dogs have never been as unhealthy and with lots of mixed
messages, pet parents are a little confused – we're here to sort it.

We keep it real and don't follow fads. We're not afraid to stand up and speak the truth and like to do things a little
differently. As a dynamic challenger brand making waves in the industry it couldn't be a more exciting time to join
us and help break the mould.

We believe that businesses can (and should) help change the world for the better. You'll be a part of a unique
'social business' helping transform the lives of cats and dogs we serve, the environment and the communities
around us.

Let's get ready to Scrumbles!

The Role - help make Scrumbles a household name

  • Grow an engaged social following among our key target audience
  • Create quality, engaging, shareable content that educates and entertains (digital & offline)
  • Keep our shoppers happy and in the know (and our furry friends happier)
  • Working directly with the founder to build and execute a winning content/comms strategy and calendar to support the wider business plan and values
  • Continually test and learn to ensure we're doing the things that matter
  • Build and manage our influencer community
  • Lead on POS creation
  • Support on innovation design, development and launch
  • Stay true to the Scrumbles brand across all online touchpoints to maintain the Scrumbles brand image with a consistent look, feel and TOV
  • Keep close to analytics to improve our performance to reduce our CPA
  • Monitor social media conversations. You will be our ear to the ground.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Daily cuddles with Scrumbles’ furrier members
  • Free food for your furry family
  • The opportunity to join a start-up early in its mission where you can make a real difference

What we ask:

  • At least finished university degree
  • Loves animals and ethical businesses
  • Is an excellent communicator and creative thinker
  • Has an active, well-rounded personal presence in social media
  • Is a natural problem solver with an analytical mind
  • Enjoys the fast-paced nature of a start-up
  • A passion and hunger to make a big impact
  • Has an analytical mind
  • Is organised and calm under pressure with the ability to prioritise
  • Bonus points for: Adobe and previous experience in a similar role

What are you going to do

Tonsser is a social network and the leading app for youth football players in Europe, empowering the next generation of football players to perform, improve, and get discovered. We're looking for an English-speaking, driven intern whose dream is to start their career at a dynamic company, where exceeding expectations is rewarded and where a mistake is never so big that it isn't treated as learning. We value the kind of person who we can rely on and who makes people around him/her better or happier, whichever comes first.

Data and football knowledge is in our DNA and we highly value research whenever we have to make decisions that will affect our users. This jobs calls for a tenacious candidate that can help us scale our research activities to understand the motivations, needs and problems of more than 600.000 users in Europe.

  • First hand experience of how products are built in a startup environment

  • Experience with top tier research and engagement tools (eg. Intercom, Typeform, Amplitude)

  • Do you like games? We have developers, so of course we'll geek out on the computers once in a while

What we ask:

  • Tenacious: perseverance is a big part of success
  • Deep knowledge of English Football
  • Fascinated by mobile apps and the part they play in our daily lives
  • Basic understanding of qualitative and quantitative methods of research
  • You are able to work part-time or full-time
